intro: Trachelium caeruleum var. halteratum, commonly known as the blue trachelium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
